Definition according UN LCCS: tree canopy >70 %, almost all needle leaf trees remain green all year. Canopy is never without green foliage.
tree canopy >70 %, consists of seasonal needle leaf tree communities with an annual cycle of leaf-on and leaf-off periods
tree canopy >70 %, almost all broadleaf trees remain green year round. Canopy is never without green foliage.
tree  canopy  >70 %,  consists  of  seasonal broadleaf tree communities with an annual cycle of leaf-on and leaf-off periods.
Closed forest, mix of types
Closed forest, not matching any of the other definitions

top layer- trees 15-70 % and second layer- mixed of shrubs and grassland, almost all needle leaf trees remain green all year.
Canopy is never without green foliage.
top layer- trees 15-70 % and second layer- mixed of shrubs and grassland, consists of seasonal needle leaf tree communities with an annual cycle of leaf-on and leaf-off periods
top layer- trees 15-70 % and second layer- mixed of shrubs and grassland, almost all broadleaf trees remain green year round. Canopy is never without green foliage.

top layer- trees 15-70 % and second layer- mixed of shrubs and grassland, consists of seasonal broadleaf tree communities with
an annual cycle of leaf-on and leaf-off periods.
Open forest, mix of types
Open forest, not matching any of the other definitions

These   are   woody   perennial   plants   with persistent and woody stems and without any defined main stem being less than 5 m tall. The shrub foliage can be either evergreen
or deciduous.

Plants without persistent stem or shoots above ground and lacking definite firm structure. Tree and shrub cover is less than
10 %.

Lands with a permanent mixture of water and herbaceous or woody vegetation. The vegetation can be present in either salt,
brackish, or fresh water.
Moss and lichen
Lands with exposed soil, sand, or rocks and never has more than 10 % vegetated cover during any time of the year

Lands covered with temporary crops followed by harvest and a bare soil period (e.g., single and multiple cropping systems). Note that perennial woody crops will be classified as the appropriate forest
or shrub land cover type.
Land covered by buildings and other man- made structures
Lands under snow or ice cover throughout the year.
lakes, reservoirs, and rivers. Can be either fresh or salt-water bodies.

Oceans, seas. Can be either fresh or salt-
water bodies.
